message.content:
cs.CR, cs.LG, cs.SE, cs.PL, cs.DC

This paper discusses foundational topics related to smart contracts, including terminology, automation, enforceability, and semantics. It also proposes a semantic framework for smart contracts and explores the design landscape and research directions. Given these topics, the most likely sub-category is cs.CR (Cryptography and Security), as smart contracts are often used in blockchain technology and security is a crucial aspect of their implementation. The paper also discusses machine learning and automation, which could place it in the cs.LG (Machine Learning) sub-category. Additionally, the paper discusses software engineering (cs.SE), programming languages (cs.PL), and distributed computing (cs.DC), which are all relevant to the design and implementation of smart contracts.
